channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WI

item.title: Report E-2024060419
item.description:
Report E-2024060419

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-21T15:17:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-07
  • City: NEENAH
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CURA EMERGENCY SERVICES, L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 7, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN2922 was punctured in transit and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Valley Environmental Response (VER) to remediate the impacted site. VER deployed neutralizers to the trailer floor, surrounding cargo and collected one (1) 5-gallon plastic pail into one (1) 55-gallon double lined poly drum. VER utilized absorbent pads and neutralizer to the impacted cargo. VER neutralized the wooden pallet, deconstructed it with hand tools, and placed it into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. Crews utilized hand tools to collect all spent absorbent pads, neutralizers, and containerized it into the same one (1) 55-gallon poly drum as the deconstructed pallet. VER staged onsite the two (2) 55-gallon poly drums of waste for further handling

item.title: Report I-2024060026
item.description:
Report I-2024060026

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-21T15:17:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-07
  • City: Sun Prairie
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN WELDING & GAS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver finished C02 customer fill process. While fill hose was being retracted on hose reel, it unexpectedly contacted the vapor ball valve and it inadvertently opened causing Carbon Dioxide to vent out of the delivery vehicle. Driver could not visually locate vapor ball valve due to carbon dioxide cloud. Driver's supervisor instructed driver to move vehicle to open area so cloud could dissipate. Local fire department was contacted by witness. Fire department showed up on scene and assisted with closing vapor ball valve which stopped the uncontrolled release of carbon dioxide. The total event took approximately 40 minutes.

item.title: Report X-2024060847
item.description:
Report X-2024060847

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-18T15:12:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-13
  • City: SUPERIOR
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was discovered to be leaking after being brought to the beltline to be loaded to a delivery vehicle. Emergency spot was pulled and sort stopped until QA got the spill cleaned up. Neutralizer and absorbent were used to contain spill. Package was placed into a hazmat damage bin to contain rest of spill. Package was then processed accordingly.

item.title: Report E-2024060136
item.description:
Report E-2024060136

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-18T15:12:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-01
  • City: MENOMONEE FALLS
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A Veolia employee noticed spillage outside of a Veolia straight truck parked in the 10-Day Facility lot around 9:00a., and reported the incident immediately. Employees immediately offloaded the truck to identify the drum that was releasing the material, to find that the suspect drum had imploded. There were no evident punctures or abrasions on the drum, so the suspected cause of the leakage is due to a faulty seam on the drum. The spill was cleaned up with oil dry and the drum was overpacked for continued transportation to the disposal facility.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO SORT AISLE FOR A LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE. SPILL WAS CONTAINED AND TAKEN TO DMP FOR PROCESSING. UPON INSPECTION IT WAS FOUND THAT ONE OF THE BOTTLE CAPS WAS ASKEW. CAP WAS ABLE TO BE SCREWED BACK ON PROPERLY.

item.title: Report E-2024060153
item.description:
Report E-2024060153

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-17T18:16:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-24
  • City: STOUGHTON
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that due to a forklift puncture approximately 1-gallon of Power Team Acid Rinse (Non-Foaming Acid Cleaner) - (Hazardous - UN3264) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the pallet and box container and absorbed. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable placing the impacted box with the 4 damaged jugs donning the proper PPE per SDS. The released product and damaged box with containers will be placed into a 55-gallon poly drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.
